SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements emphasize user customization, specifically around health data and privacy settings.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-007-FR-003 focuses on customizing health reminders and data aggregation for healthcare providers, while P-003-FR-001 focuses on customizable privacy settings for health data sharing.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Customizable Health Preferences and Privacy
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall allow users to customize health reminders and privacy settings, enabling them to specify which health data is collected, how it is shared, and providing clear options and summaries. It shall also aggregate and anonymize data for healthcare providers while maintaining user privacy.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements emphasize ease of use and intuitive design for users with varying technical abilities.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-007-NFR-002 focuses on an accessible interface for older adults, while P-006-FR-002 focuses on a simplified dashboard for caregivers managing multiple clients.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Intuitive and Accessible Interface
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall feature an accessible and intuitive interface designed for older adults and caregivers, ensuring ease of use, minimal learning curve, and efficient management of multiple clients' care schedules and health data.

Conflicts.Note: P-007-FR-003 requires data aggregation for healthcare providers, which may conflict with P-003-FR-001's emphasis on user-controlled privacy settings. Balancing data utility for providers with user privacy preferences is challenging.

P-007-NFR-002 prioritizes a simple interface for older adults, while P-006-FR-002 requires a more feature-rich dashboard for caregivers. Designing a system that is both simple and feature-rich may lead to UX trade-offs.
